name: Monstera Peru
climate: Monstera Peru thrives in tropical climates where the temperature ranges.
It prefers a humid environment, mirroring conditions of its native habitat.
This plant can struggle in cold climates, as it requires warmth year-round.
A temperature range of 65 to 85 degrees Fahrenheit is ideal for growth.
sunlight: Monstera Peru prefers bright, indirect sunlight to thrive properly.
Direct sunlight can damage its leaves, leading to browning or burning.
It can tolerate low light but may grow slower and with smaller leaves.
A spot near an east or north-facing window is usually the best location.
watering: Water Monstera Peru when the top inch of soil is dry to avoid overwatering.
Ensure the pot has drainage holes to prevent water from stagnating.
Use lukewarm water for watering to prevent shocking the plant system.
Frequency may vary with season; less frequent watering in winter is common.
soil: Well-draining soil is essential to keep Monstera Peru healthy and thriving.
A mix of potting soil with perlite or pine bark chips is often recommended.
The soil should retain some moisture but never become waterlogged.
Ensure the soil is rich in organic matter to support nutrient needs.
toxic: Monstera Peru is toxic to pets and humans if ingested, causing irritation.
extra_care_tip: Wipe the leaves with a damp cloth regularly to remove dust build-up.
